abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Solid Waste and
            Environmental Management Project for West Bank and Gaza is
            to improve the environmental living conditions of the people
            of Anabta and surrounding villages through an
            environmentally sound solid waste management system.
            Negative measures include: air management; noise management;
            particulates and dust smoke; wastewater management; waste
            management; and hazardous materials management. Mitigation
            measures include: a) ensure that potential air pollutants
            are contained and that activities do not impact on the
            natural environment; b) ensure that operations do not
            generate odour that causes environmental nuisance; c) ensure
            that particulate and dust emissions, both individually and
            cumulatively, meet appropriate criteria and do not cause an
            environmental or human health problem; d) ensure that noise
            and vibration levels meet acceptable standards and that an
            adequate level of service, safety and public amenity is
            maintained; and e) ensure that such wastes are not arriving
            or accepted at the site, unless special measures are taken.
